title: MURDER IN HOLLYWOOD
description: When Deductive Logico was invited to a fancy dinner party at a mansion in the Hollywood Hills, he thought he had finally made it. Unfortunately, he was not the guest of honor: he was there to solve the murder of the guest of honor.

suspects.name: THE AMAZING AUREOLIN
suspects.description: A magician who perfected the sawing-your-husband-in-two routine. Then, she made his body disappear.

suspects.name: MIDNIGHT III
suspects.description: The grandson of the founder of Midnight Movies and a self-described self-made man.

suspects.name: DAME OBSIDIAN
suspects.description: A mystery writer whose books have sold more copies than the Bible and Shakespeare combined.

weapons.name: A FORK
weapons.description: Actually a lot more gruesome than a knife, if you think about it.

weapons.name: AN ALUMINUM PIPE
weapons.description: Safer than lead, unless it hits you in the head.

weapons.name: A HEAVY CANDLE
weapons.description: Heavy enough to kill, and yet it light-ens the room.

locations.name: THE ENORMOUS BATHROOM
locations.description: A bathroom that is bigger than Deductive Logico's house.

locations.name: THE BEDROOM
locations.description: A California king-sized bed, unmade, stands in a spotless white room.

locations.name: THE SCREENING ROOM
locations.description: Red velvet seats and a popcorn machine make this the ultimate screening experience.

clues: The Amazing Aureolin trusted the suspect who brought a fork.
Midnight III was still brandishing an aluminum pipe when Logico arrived.
A heavy candle was not found in the bedroom.
Dame Obsidian was found hiding beneath red velvet seats.
The body was found inside a marble tub.
